website_summaries.verdict: An excellent entry-level device from a reputable company in GPS navigation.
pros: Warranty comes in handy in case of defects
cons: Maps for other regions must be purchased separately

customer_reviews.title: Product Overheats
customer_reviews.text: Although this product is meant to be positioned on the dash of the vehicle when in use, it overheats and stops functioning; This was in early Spring and less than 80 degrees out. But what is even more frustrating is being told by Amazon that they will not replace the unit because although it was less than 3 months since it was purchased, it was over the one month exchange/return policy.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy

customer_reviews.title: Routing
customer_reviews.text: Not very pleased with the routing on this unit. Will take you some strange routes that could be accessed with much less driving.
customer_reviews.author: Jim S

customer_reviews.title: Great device
customer_reviews.text: Used several different Garmin GPS. This one has a very clean look. Slim and not heavy. The device graphics are sharp and very clear. The font size is slightly larger than the older ones which for this senior is very appreciated. Really like it.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Gillespie

customer_reviews.title: Great Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Garmin Drivesmart 65 is a great unit, nice large screen, easy to use, voice controls, what's not to like. I have my Garmin camera also hooked to unit and works great. Con's: Would love the option to have a speech button on map screen while driving.
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: VERY BAD DIRECTIONS
customer_reviews.text: My previous Garmin was wonderful. Loved it. When it died I ordered this model right before a big 1000 mile trip. In a pre-trip test, used it coming home from work. It gave quirky directions, but I figured it was just taking me home the way it wanted, albeit way out of the way. Then on the trip, on I 90 starting in Ohio, it told me to take every exit until I shut off the sound only for the graphics. When the "turn right" every exit did not stop, even in New York, I turned off the unit. It was essentially useless. Nice features otherwise. It is being returned.
customer_reviews.author: Marial

customer_reviews.title: Brand new unit kept rebooting every couple of minutes and lost all settings
customer_reviews.text: Without warning, the unit would reboot. All settings and preferences would be lost. Tried turning it off, and then it just rebooted again. Battery was fully charged and/or it was working off of external power when these problems were encountered. I did not contact their tech support. I am not their unpaid QC department. Beautiful display, and I was interested in the optional backup camera. Software version 6.40
customer_reviews.author: Abbey Normal

customer_reviews.title: Happy Roy
customer_reviews.text: I sure like my garmin gps it came today so I put some information into my new Garmin drive smart 65. So far I was able to put in the address of my daughter that lives in Washington and I live near idaho. I had two other garmin that I had to return because I coul not put in my daughters address...I’m a 80 year old man and it’s very hard to put in the basic information...I’m happy to get this garmin gps....
customer_reviews.author: Roy S Hasebe

customer_reviews.title: Not cut out as I expected.
customer_reviews.text: Just a couple of things. I tried to have the availablity of fast food or food eatry I could not. When I tried to use it the only one that popped up was McDonald and another fast food. 2nd It is stubborn that at times I use a shorter route the GPS keeps trying to go it's route. It wont adjust to the situation. 3rd It tries to direct me to take the longer way around and causes more time consumption.
customer_reviews.author: Ben CC

customer_reviews.title: Update repeatedly fails!!!!!!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Update repeatedly fails! Keep getting message "There was an error installing the updates". After 5 tries, about an hours work! Finally gave up and returned.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Ascher

customer_reviews.title: Wast of time
customer_reviews.text: I have had a Garmin GPS for 16 years this is the worst one I have had Garmin 55, the 1st one stopped working within weeks it just froze up, ordered another one on Nov.12, 2019 it has froze but cleared it's self within minutes today it froze and won't turn off or due anything and wouldn't you know it it's passed the 30-day return today is Dec. 21, 2019 just barely over a month do not buy this Garmin drive smart 55.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas K. Whitson

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I have had GARMIN products for a while and when this came out with the Amazon Alexa that just made it easier to get instead of having a GPS and another item in the vehicle to talk with Alexa. Everything is combined and GARMIN works as it should and then some. Yes you can use your phone, but why when you can use the GARMIN it's not as fancy looking on the maps but it does just as good and the updates are easy and shows Traffic, Weather, Red light Cams etc so as for the Alexa part it works great and I'm happy with my choice
customer_reviews.author: Scott M Texidor

customer_reviews.title: Better Than I Expected
customer_reviews.text: This my 3rd Garmin and the best one yet, mostly just because technology changes as time passes. The display is very clear and I’m glad I opted for the larger screen. It fits great in the side window nook on our Prius, so it’s out of the way, but still very accessible. We have navigation in the Prius, but it’s outdated and too expensive to update. It gets us where we want to go, but the Garmin let’s me access current POIs, etc., so it’s a perfect companion.
customer_reviews.author: DoubleDAZ

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: I bought this GPS as a replacement for an older model that wasn't as accurate as it used to be. This new model works great (so far) and I like the new features like telling me to turn at the stoplight and the tone when a speed limit is about to be reduced. I have 2 issues with it. First, the battery doesn't stay charged. I don't know if it never truly shuts off or it just can't hold a charge. Second, the search function doesn't find locations that I know are in the database. I know they're in the database, cause I eventually found them by browsing the categories. Overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: R. Osborne

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a trip
customer_reviews.text: We got this to use in Italy and it was well worth the price! Works great, SUPER EASY set up. WAY cheaper than using your phone's data or renting some other type of internet product. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffo

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: What a wonderful experience using this product Used it when I took my wife back to Oklahoma to be laid to rest and it really impressed me on every aspect of the product it never let me down once and I will say this if you are looking for a great navigator give this on a try I don't think you would be disappointed
customer_reviews.author: MI2432

customer_reviews.title: It lasted less than 6 months, contacted Garmin
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this Garmin 65 in January and didn't use it that much due to the covid virus and not taking any trips. Turned it on the last of May for a trip after charging the GPS, The screen came up and seemed everything was working fine, then the screen frooze then when I powered it down the GPS would NOT power up again. I attempted the soft reset for 20 seconds without any bootup of the GPS. I contacted Garmin and we'll see what they can do about the useless GPS?
customer_reviews.author: nikboom

customer_reviews.title: Better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, fires up and ready to use. Dont have to have a degree in IT to use it. Very accurate location sensing. I use this because it utilizes satellite not cell tower signal. Ever try to look at a map and tiny directions on a cell while driving hands free with phone mounted on dash while it is raining in traffic going 70mph? Or similar driving conditions? Ever experience loss of cell tower signal in the middle of nowhere? Problem completely 100% solved with this product. Super happy. Shipping lightening fast, was told a week, got it in 2 days. Holy smokes. Im very impressed with whole thing.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Ference

customer_reviews.title: Useless if you want Bluetooth functions
customer_reviews.text: Seriously? This thing isn’t compatible with anything other than my iPhone 8. Not my 2018 Chevy Silverado, not my 2019 Sena helmet and not my 2019 motorcycle fairing with Bluetooth, who needs a gps connected to their phone? I can see it not working with the helmet and bike, but a 2018 Chevrolet? So POd right now. And btw, entering an address takes an act of Congress, I’ll stick with my 10 year old Nuvi. Called support and was told that they aren’t compatible with very many things
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Does the trick
customer_reviews.text: My husband was using a Garmin that was about 20 years old. It still worked great, but the maps were out of date and sometimes took him where he didn't really want to go. This new one is great. The voice is very clear, the maps are spot on and she doesn't get mad if you don't follow her directions. Good purchase and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the $
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband since he has to travel for his work. We take it with us when we go out of town as well. The garmin app you download for traffic alerts does drain your battery on your cell every day but my husband drives around on service calls all day so he can’t afford to be sitting in traffic. This is better then the traffic cord in older models! I will take his cell battery being plugged in every day over him being late for his service calls or stuck in traffic coming home from DC area any day!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works very well with Garmin's wireless backup camera
customer_reviews.text: Provides a clear and vivid view of what's behind your car and the surrounding area. I'm able to park in areas I otherwise could not get out of with my particular small car.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Catanzaro

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: I have been a user of Garmin products for a long time. I bought this unit about a month back and have to say it is the best one yet. The maps could use some updating as my phone sees streets that the Garmin map does not show but other than that it is a great tool for driving. It's easy to use and has a lot of useful features.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Love it but...
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot to like about this Garmin DriveSmart 65lm. It's loaded with features. However, I found the voice recognition to be substandard. I had to rephrase my question and repeat it too many times in order for it to be recognized. Too frustrating. I would have expected better especially in this age of smart things. I returned the unit to Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Borzoi

customer_reviews.title: Much better than phone based apps and possibly car built-in units
customer_reviews.text: Far better than my M-B built-in sat nav unit, which is rubbish. Add Alexa capability to it and its, in my estimation, the perfect sat nav travelling companion. Honestly cannot think of any negatives. The user interface is intuitive and not too busy. The graphics - maps, music data, etc. - are great. Free map updates don't hurt either. The only cautionary item is that mounting can be a bit fussy depending upon your car’s dash. Suction-to-glass mounting tends to block your view. I opted for an aftermarket CD player slot mount made to fit the Garmin swivel ball. Perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M1n1fan

customer_reviews.title: Best Garmin yet - still has subpar battery
customer_reviews.text: Have not used voice recognition. Been using Garmins for years. This has the brightest, clearest screen if any I’ve had. Touch screen works well. One pet peeve of mine with Garmin products is the poor charge-retaining capacity of their batteries. It discharges to low status too quickly, even after driving fir hours with the unit connected to a power source. Love Garmins in strange locals. The units just stop working after a few years. Screens are easier for me to see than a smart phone screen, and it has good navigation features for restaurants, entertainment, national parks, venues, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F. Hallmark

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin got me from Georgia to Massachusetts without a hitch until I got to the Boston area. I’m assuming it got offline because of a terrible storm and being so close to the ocean. ??? It took me on pretzel turns off the expressway and onto surface streets. Since I didn’t know the area, I was forced to just follow it and after 45 minutes I got back to expressway. I was only 2 minutes from my exit before it took me another way and there was no traffic issue; so it wasn’t preventing me from any traffic issues.
customer_reviews.author: PATTI

customer_reviews.title: Can't do the same with a Mac as a Windows machine.
customer_reviews.text: I have always enjoyed the Garmin GPS units I have had in the past but feel let down by the purchase of this one. Garmin has removed the capability of the user, when using a Mac computer, to connect the device to their computer and work with the device drives, such as moving files around or adding items such as voices and vehicles. The only thing I can do is connect to my computer and use Garmin Express to do updates. This is important but not the same as a Windows user is capable of doing. The manual, and on line, information make it sound like you can still view the volumes on either.
customer_reviews.author: RBaker

customer_reviews.title: Almost Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Great screen placing. I have owned Garmin's in the past. Their voice command doesn't work well. "Garmin take me to the nearest Safeway Store". Pause, then "You want to go to a gun store?". This one works perfectly, you don't even have to yell at it. My one complaint is that it takes 30 seconds to 2 minutes to "Acquire Satelittes" occasionally. Not every time, but often enough to be annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Ball

customer_reviews.title: Had two bad units in a row. First one died completely second one won't hold a charge
customer_reviews.text: Battery takes about 24 hours to charge on the USB and then it only holds a charge for about 20 minutes with a full battery. The unit has to be plugged in at all times. I had a Garmin GPS 10 years ago and although technology has changed I would say the current model is worse than my 10 year old model. the interface, calculating route, touch screen and build quality is from the far past. I think for the cost of these you would be better off buying an older phone and just using it for GPS on Google maps.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Z

customer_reviews.title: My Mother is using it fine
customer_reviews.text: My mom wanted a new GPS for Christmas. Her current one looked 15 years old, but it wouldn't die! We ordered her this model specifically because it claimed to not need anything cell phone related to work. She still has a flip phone, so it was near a challenge to find the perfect one for her. We ordered this, and my sister got it initially set up for her, and it was enough to get her up and going! She loves it. Even though I would not call her a GPS expert, she can work this one. I recommend for your moms and dads that might not be too tech savvy.
customer_reviews.author: H. L. Cross

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with this product. It was a replacement of a 10+ year old Garmin Nuvi. Love the "addition" of speed limit and turn lane indicators. I know that feature has been around for a while, but big improvement from what I had. One thing I miss is the variety of voice options.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Beam

customer_reviews.title: Battery Does Not Hold Charge
customer_reviews.text: The first unit I received did not charge so I returned for a replacement. The new one although can be charged up, the battery cannot hold charge for more than 15 min. One section of US Hwy 36 added a toll lane recently and the GPS treated that section of the road as tolled. That little disk that attached to the back of the GPS to connect to the suction mount is difficult to remove. The only saving grace for this GPS is the price, I guess you get what you paid for.
customer_reviews.author: C. K. Chan

customer_reviews.title: Bad
customer_reviews.text: Way too many problems to list. Touchscreen never registers the right touch, the suction falls at every bump, screen can barely be seen in sunlight and is glaring at night. Ultimately it just stopped working out of nowhere and was a waste of money. I bought a double din for my CarPlay instead now for navigation.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I love the voice recognition, but I need to turn off the radio for it to properly understand me if there is background noise. It is very convenient. The accuracy is not 100% in my area in Maine. It insists on getting me to exit on one particular exit to make a left, and there are no left turns allowed and there never could have been left turns allowed by the curve of the exit, so it's not like they changed the road or signage. I'm sure the accuracy is better in more developed areas - it's kind of rural up here. I had a Garmin in Florida for five years, and it was very accurate in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Mary C

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Owned and used a Garmin 1350LTM for 7 years. This model is a piece of junk! Battery would not hold a charge, and the blue tooth is terrible. Had to jump through hoops trying to get a refund!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff DeSmith

customer_reviews.title: It has trip advisor on it.
customer_reviews.text: Using the trip advisor locator is great. Has points of interest on it. I thought I would hate the speed limit indicator on it but found out alot of cities change the speed limit on their freeways. The voice commands are very clear and keeps you relaxed and alert for the off ramps and lane changes.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Vergeront

customer_reviews.title: Updating a map or software is so hard
customer_reviews.text: Everything works as intended except when I need to perform an update. Self-update never works. It just enters a halfly drawn self-update progress UI and reboots itself, without applying the update. All previous updates were performed with Garmin Express, which took tens of trials before Windows can detect its existence. It just kept rebooting itself, asking to get into File Transfer mode, and rebooting a while later. It took tens of such cycles before it could be connected. It's possible it has some hardware defect.
customer_reviews.author: Garfield Xu, Tan

customer_reviews.title: Not a big improvement
customer_reviews.text: Takes a bit longer to get to find address. The major problem that I am is that the unit freezes up and you have to manually reset to get the unit to come back on. Also having problems finding satellite signal. I am in a major metropolitan area. When this happens I need to manually reset the unit they it seems to work fine.
customer_reviews.author: Margaret Snow

customer_reviews.title: Lost Navigator
customer_reviews.text: I must start out by saying that Garmin was at the forefront of the navigation industry. But Garmin has fallen off exponentially. This Garmin in 40% of the time is inaccurate, losing its bearing and after the maps are updated, this product still can't find its way around. Waze does a much better job and Waze is free. I feel that I throw away my money. The reason I purchased Garmin DiveSmart 55 was to take my hands of the Phone when I'm driving.
customer_reviews.author: Jose J.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, with one needed improvement
customer_reviews.text: The mounting base needs to go back to how the 3597 was. It was so nice to be able to just keep the base connected, then throw the GPS on the magnet mount, which also charges the device. I dislike having to find the cord somewhere on my car's floor and then plugging it into the GPS. I do like how I can update the device over wifi rather than having to connect it to a computer. One other improvement could be the glass used for the screen to improve the clarity and sharpness of it. The screen is good, but I've been spoiled with how much better phone screens are compared to the GPSs out there.
customer_reviews.author: Prime

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle or money
customer_reviews.text: We really wanted a GPS without bells and whistles but was accurate when phone reception was a problem. The unit gave mistaken directions several times on a 8000 mile trip. Sometimes it was way way off. Mind you, we updated initially .... just like you are supposed to. By the end of the trip we were using the phone for anything detailed and sometimes believed the this Garmin unit. After the trip and a few local rides, it just plain quit. Nothing. No screen, no nothing. In general, it never matched the capability of an old TomTom and never did as good as our phones.
customer_reviews.author: Roland

customer_reviews.title: Garmin GPS a great addition
customer_reviews.text: My vehicle came equipped with a very rudimentary GPS and I wanted something with interactive maps, traffic, and easy to use interface. I shopped for on-board systems at auto audio/video stores, and discovered that many of the very expensive systems use Garmin as their GPS interface. So instead of paying over $1000 for a complete audio interface, I spent less than $200 for this Garmin GPS and it functions just as I needed! Easy to use, and I get map updates at no cost (most vehicle GPS systems require a new card or other expensive updates).
customer_reviews.author: Tina C

customer_reviews.title: Very good overall expierience
customer_reviews.text: Very nice, voice recognition is good, WiFi update is awesome, hands free calling works well, Garmin drive is good (install it on your phone). Only issue so far is accuracy, occasionally said I was gong to wrong way when I was not, sometimes said I was on the correct route when I was not. Overall, fast to load, clear good touch screen, powers down automatically. I would strongly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Fish4Fun

customer_reviews.title: Love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this thing. I use it all day every day work. Keeps me from getting lost and has not sent me to the wrong place yet. Love the life time maps that get updated regularly. I love being able to put in intersection and have it get me there. This model also has traffic alerts but only when used with the power cord it came with.
customer_reviews.author: T 28

customer_reviews.title: Clear directions and good traffic info
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for an older Garmin. I wanted the later screen and the traffic info is an improvement over my old unit. The screen is large and easy to read. Lighting self adjusts and works great for me. The traffic info is great. It was easy to upgrade and all my saved POIs easily transferred onto the new unit.
customer_reviews.author: WEJosey

customer_reviews.title: Best one yet!!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you prefer a larger display. When the exit comes up it even shows you what lane to be in. This is very helpful driving a large service truck not being able to maneuver like a car. The arrival time fluctuates calculating traffic as you drive. Garmin will continue to get my business as this is my fourth gps in 11 years.
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: Garmin GPS, all the way
customer_reviews.text: Great GPS Garmin unit. You can say 'ok garmin' followed by 'go home' and it really does start the route to go home. While driving say 'ok garmin' 'get gas' and Bam, list of gas stations on the way there! Supports back up camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kamazon

customer_reviews.title: Ready to use!
customer_reviews.text: Ready to use out of the box! I'll have to get used to it (again) as I tried a couple other brands over the last couple years. This is my first new Garmin; my first was refurbished, lasted a couple years & quit, we'll see how the DriveSmart 55 works out. Happy so far
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Great GPS
customer_reviews.text: Is really amazing and beautiful this GPS. The Drive app works great and although it provides functions that the Smart Link does not yet have, Garmin must to continue working on it to provide features such as completely controlling the behavior of the GPS from the cellphone, I think that is the fundamental objective of that application, to avoid having to touch the GPS buttons that may be on the windshield far from our reach. I hope Garmin developers continue to make improvements and refine those features that already exist. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Reinaldo Gibert

customer_reviews.title: Accurate turn directions, road work ahead warnings, clear easy to understand voice.
customer_reviews.text: I like the feature that warns you before you enter a reduced speed zone. My first use was for a 1100 mile round trip; fastest routes were chosen; I was surprised the first time I received a "Roadwork ahead" warning about 1 mile before the stop for one way traffic. The unit chimes to warn you of reduced speed zone ahead; so was a mystery for a short time. GPS lock on is considerably faster than the older Garmin Nuvi GPS I used on previous trips. I would purchase this item again.
customer_reviews.author: James R. Bull

customer_reviews.title: Not Bad fro the Price
customer_reviews.text: Well, the DriveSmart 55 is a new model of Garmin GPS. It has a Bluetooth that allows you hand free to your cell phone. It has a Loud enough speaker. I very much like the interface except for the fact that doesn't allow me to put icons of my choose on the screen as the late 3590LMT did. Also, It annoys me that the (+) and (-) sign is on the left side of the screen all the time. Why??? Anyway, It has a lot of new features and I do recommend. After all is a GARMIN product. You cant go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: FM

customer_reviews.title: undecided
customer_reviews.text: used it along with another GPS built in our vehicle, same address, this GPS once we got to 3/4 of way to our location, it was telling us to go past our location (who knows to where, I didn't look) . I re-entered address and it was on track with our GPS. This only happened once out of about 5 times using it. We purchased it for a different vehicle that does not have GPS, I learned if we are going to use we will have to look up the directions on a map and print off.
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie Bertel

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.text: Have had Garmin’s before and never had an issue. Thought I would upgrade. Huge mistake. Took me through an apartment complex only to come out to the same road I left! Told me to turn left at the light and then told me turn right! Did this several times. Told me I arrived at my destination and I was on the wrong road and a half a mile away. Four hour trip turned into five and a half hours! Will use my Google maps on my phone from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Retired in FL

customer_reviews.title: Best gps on the market. Period end of story.
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the finest gps I’ve ever owned and I’ve had a lot of em. The accuracy with finding addresses and the voice control is flawless. It’s not a cheap unit but if your like me trying to find multiple addresses every day in areas with no service don’t waste your time with other products. Garmin has outdone their self with this one. I love how it shows accurate representations of the exits and turns coming up also. This is a great unit and if you plan on using a god everyday go with this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dman 721

customer_reviews.title: Junk Garmins!
customer_reviews.text: Stopped turning on after a week. Requested a replacement, and the replacement only last a few weeks and the display went blank and is unresponsive, just like the first one I ordered. These are used units and I would caution anyone from buying any of these. The ones I bought from the seller only lasted a week to three weeks maximum. But of course it’s beyond the time that I can replace it. Now I have a piece of plastic that doesn’t do anything with no buyers recourse at all.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Hamilton

customer_reviews.title: Worked for 3.5 months
customer_reviews.text: 3.5 months after receiving this, the screen went black. Checked the power cord, and used it on another garmin 7 inch screen, so the cord is ok. In use it tried to send me down 3 one way streets in Phila PA the wrong way. Its Junk.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: JUST EXCELLENT
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after my Garmin Nuvi died after many years of almost daily year round use. This SmartDrive Garmin is just great-the large size screen makes it easy for my old (77 yrs) eyes to see-it has numerous alerts that come in handy especially when driving on strange roads (NOTE: the alerts can be turned off if not needed)-I do like the dash mounted Garmins since one does not have to look down at a console type GPS and thereby taking your eyes off the road.
customer_reviews.author: tjmadison

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am disappointed in it because I was hoping that it would give me the same info that Waze gives. It doesn't give you any important info such as disabled cars, pot holes, road kill on the roadway or police activity. In order to get that info I still need my phone with Waze. Going to return this and stay with my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Harry M

customer_reviews.title: Ok buy.
customer_reviews.text: Use it daily for work. The only issue is it connects then disconnects to Bluetooth randomly throughout the night which messes up if music is playing, if I’m on the phone etc. then it will shut off if I stop somewhere when the vehicle shuts off, then takes quite a while to power back on. I thought these devices would have a battery life to sustain- and for this price I guess I’m not overly thrilled with it. They have some kinks to work out in the background but the screen and images and good. The directions have been a little off, other than that good buy.
customer_reviews.author: C.Kalin

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for the 06 Ody Nav System...
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, big display and easy to follow. The Navigation System on my Odyssey was dim and finally died. I thought that I could lower the old screen and mount the Garmin in the opening. Couldn’t close the old screen, so I stuck the Garmin on the old screen and it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: If you want a GPS device highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.text: Like all voice recognition products took a couple times to learn my voice. Traffic, red light cameras, train crossing, and speed limit alerts on point! The touch screen is accurate and speed of device is great. It's like having an HD TV in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: GPS UNIT  Garmin 55
customer_reviews.text: Has lots of features - manual is built in to a program on the unit so if you even need to find "how to do some thing " it's e-z to find . have not used "voice command yet " but believe it will work well. ! so far great unit..
customer_reviews.author: glenn

customer_reviews.title: Great Garmin GPS
customer_reviews.text: I have just received this Garmin GPS, but it does seem to be an improvement on the other Gamins that I have been using in the past. I have not tried the voice recognition, and I do not plan to use the Bluetooth phone features, so it will be just a GPS, and that was my plan all along.
customer_reviews.author: Dick Krueger

customer_reviews.title: It's OK....meh
customer_reviews.text: It works, but a bit clunky. Much better than the generic GPS that I had to return because it was so bad but not nearly as intuitive or easy to program as my old TomTom. It finally died and the reviews on the new budget tomtoms were not good. The Garmin is OK but I hate how difficult it is to punch in a destination.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: I love the improvements, but...
customer_reviews.text: I love the improvements: big bright screen with great clarity, traffic updates, voice control, all that. Wonderful. BUT: the unit is heavy and the vacuum mount is not strong enough. Indeed, it's the same size as the one on my old 5" unit. It falls off the windscreen and it falls off the weighted holder on the dash. It also pulled a vent-mounted holder out of the vent. Garmin needs to address this with a larger, stronger vacuum mount
customer_reviews.author: Robyn Daly

customer_reviews.title: Upgraded to Garmin DriveSmart 65 from NUVIA 55
customer_reviews.text: So far working great, I have only had it on one trip from Ohio thru Canada and back. We like the advanced warning of turns and naming street and route numbers before being right on top of the turn. Will update review as time goes on.
customer_reviews.author: Luanne K Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Don’t waste your money!!!
customer_reviews.text: Worst GPS I have ever owned! Bought it for a 1200 mile trip (I gave my previous GPS to my son). All down Interstate 95 it kept saying the interstate was closed and took us down secondary roads which had large tolls. Kept bringing us in circles wherever we tried to go. I am returning this immediately.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Not very goid. Terrible, and slow for voice commands
customer_reviews.text: This was to replace a previous Garmin that died, or was made obsolete by Garmin. It has a marginally larger screen and is otherwise nearly the dame as my previous DriveSmart. The voice recognition is absolutely horrendous. Several times lately I've had to vetbally ask directions on my phone from Google because the Garmin just couldn't understand simple English despite several tries and different phrasing.
customer_reviews.author: Tom in Lynden

customer_reviews.title: Decided my old GPS was just as good for me.
customer_reviews.text: Mostly disliked that when planning a 'shortest route' it took me out of my way and definitely not the shortest route. I liked that it found many businesses and locations when search and also the voice input was good but since I'm used to my older TomTom I decided to wait 'til something better comes on the market.
customer_reviews.author: John Huegel

customer_reviews.title: Super Device! Super Fast Shipping!
customer_reviews.text: I love it. I was a TomTom user for years till I went to update live traffic on my GO 60 and it all went horribly wrong in every way on TomToms end. Bye TomTom, Hello Garmin!!
customer_reviews.author: Struben1

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I’m an HVAC Service Tech. I use this GPS in a work truck running calls all over the place. Voice Recognition is spot on almost 100% of the time for Garmi & Alexa. Much better than previous models I have had. Plugging into the stereo system and having Amazon music is awesome. Everything is hands off, which makes it easy. Updating is wireless & no hassle. If this broke I’d buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Insufficient Satellite Coverage
customer_reviews.text: This GPS doesn't converse well with the satellite. The whole reason for having a GPS these days is a satellite backup where your phone has no reception. There was no satellite signal driving between the Sonoma County coast and the wine country, or in the rolling hills east of Berkeley, where there was also no phone signal. My older GPS (stolen, unfortunately) had a much better reception of the satellite signal.
customer_reviews.author: Mickey M.

customer_reviews.title: Great as a co-pilot even for those that know where are and going.
customer_reviews.text: The voice recognition works, it opens up to voice commands. Accuracy of recognition of what I say is hit and miss, probably to my accent. The touch screen is far superior to our last model which is nearing six (6) years old. The screen is larger which is helpful. Overall we are pleased with our purchase.
customer_reviews.author: mark

customer_reviews.title: Bad voice recognition.
customer_reviews.text: Voice recognition is abysmal, try finding 5000 5th street. I was able to get it to find "McDonalds" on the third try, however, the McDonalds I was attempting to locate was 5 miles away, and it was on the 8th screen down from the first, it listed many locations much further away (10-20 miles). I like the display, it is bright and easy to read, Directions to locations that you can get it to find are reliable.
customer_reviews.author: Barry E.

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS to date
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to replace the Garmin Nuvi 2689LMT which had developed an apparently common problem with the screen turning black when the charger was plugged in. This GPS is accurate, the screen display is sharp and well organized. After months of frustration with the old Garmin my husband is delighted with this GPS. I shouldn't have waited so long to replace the Nuvi :)
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: A grate GPS Garmin DriveSmart
customer_reviews.text: The product came in a timely manner and the Garmin GPS is as Advertised. I only wish I did more research for the Garmin with Alixa Voice with Bluetooth Audio Out. This is what I was hoping for in the Garmin 65 series GPS. Once you buy it, make sure it's what your looking for (The deal is done).
customer_reviews.author: Charles E. Florer Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this unit. Great display and a lot of features. The touch screen is very responsive. Voice recognition works great. Can’t imagine what else you would need. I replaced a Magellan unit that was terrible. Accuracy on this unit seems great. The only down side is the internal memory. There is not enough. Buy a Micro SD card at the same time so you can do all the updates. Would definitely recommend this unit.
customer_reviews.author: Harry K.

customer_reviews.title: Top quality GPS
customer_reviews.text: We love this garmin. So easy to use.. updates automatically when near wifi. Voice command is the best.
customer_reviews.author: D. Drost

customer_reviews.title: Next Génération GPS
customer_reviews.text: Very exact , and easy to see and hear, and smart GPS. Also very usefull if your car has no Blue Tooth, as now you can call and receive calls with out holding a phone in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kaponya

customer_reviews.title: Garmin rules!
customer_reviews.text: Haven't used voice recog yet (and prob won't) but so far it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Cameron

customer_reviews.title: It's works as a good gps
customer_reviews.text: The speaker on it when you're on your cell phone is very hard to understand Microphone when on your phone the other people can't hear you very well Overall it's a great GPS I love every feature of it except the speakerphone they could have made it so you can plug it into any USB power but they don't they make it so you have to plug it into the charger that came with it and not anything else
customer_reviews.author: Little Foxxie

customer_reviews.title: Very nice GPS
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, love that it can update on your home network wirelessly! Nice big screen, my wife uses it often and it works for her very well. Used on a long trip recently, very accurate, love the large screen.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Parker

customer_reviews.title: This was a Replacement for a Nuvi 2598
customer_reviews.text: This was a Replacement for a Nuvi 2598 that was stolen out of my Jeep Wrangler. We've been very pleased with it's performance and we will probably buy another one if and when the Nuvi 2598 in my Ford Expedition needs replacing.
customer_reviews.author: Copper

customer_reviews.title: Great Navigation
customer_reviews.text: Played with this navigation at best buy and decided to buy on prime because it was cheaper. Works amazing and very accurate. Have had absolutely no issues with it. Screen is vibrant, touch works flawlessly, voice recognition could be better though. Would definitely recommend for others
customer_reviews.author: T.Graham

customer_reviews.title: Good price and quality
customer_reviews.text: So far this has worked well. It has a feature that won’t let you manage or adjust it while driving but that can be dismissed. Suction has held up so far in dropping temperatures. Very easy to setup
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: would buy from this seller again
customer_reviews.text: everything went fine, ordered it, got it, was what I ordered nice job, would buy from this seller again
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works as Expected
customer_reviews.text: I have only used it for a short trip but had no issues with its performance
customer_reviews.author: JillB

customer_reviews.title: NOT 100% ACCURATE, FEATURES ARE INFERIOR TO COMPETITION AND MORE EXPENSIVE UNITS
customer_reviews.text: AT THE POINT OF THE TURN, THE SCREEN WILL STILL READ SOMETHING LIKE "200 YARDS", THATS POOR ACCURACY, ALSO THE "INTERSECTION" OR "CROSS STREET " FEATURE DOES NO TPERFORM AS WELL AS MY OLD TOM TOM, AND THE "TEXT" ONLY FEATURE I FOUND MUCH BETTER ALSO ON MY OLD TOM TOM. I NEED A GOOD AND RELIABLE GPS FOR BUSINESS, THIS DID NOT LIVE UP TO MY STANDARDS, I HAVE RETURNED FOR FULL REFUND AND PURCHASED A TOM TOM FOR $75 MORE, BUT FIND ITS WORTH THE EXTRA $$
customer_reviews.author: Vincent Lofranco

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade from my old small nuvi
customer_reviews.text: This Garmin Drive Smart 65 is a nice upgrade from my old Garmin. The large screen makes it easier to find the correct exit in complicated urban driving; the pictures of the exit signs helps. We use the smartphone app to allow the passenger to easily enter destinations and the voice recognition feature to allow the driver to enter commands. The traffic feature also works very good and access to tripadvisor is helpful. We have been very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan B.

customer_reviews.title: Voice recognition need a lot of work...
customer_reviews.text: It never acknowledges your voice on the first try.. Always have to repeat myself two, three, four times... It can be frustrating at times.. Sometimes I find myself having to yell and that doesn't work sometimes....
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Best value and Alexa works great!
customer_reviews.text: YOUR VOLUME IS TIED TO YOUR PHONE, in addition to the Garmin itself. Love the Alexa feature!!! It really is a dream My first order had Bluetooth trouble, but I called Amazon and requested a return and reorder. Amazon was SUPER!!!! The second one works beautifully, just like my very old of before it died, last month. I had the Garmin 70. Thus one is a true upgrade. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: MM

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this model when my older Garmin Nuvi 50 fell and broke the power connector. I'm pleased with the accuracy, but disappointed with the display. The Nuvi was much easier to view, especially the display which shows speed in large numbers, but the map is difficult for my aging eyes to see clearly, as well.
customer_reviews.author: Henry F. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Call tech support 9133978200
customer_reviews.text: Love tech support at Garmin they have the patience my mother had when I was young!
customer_reviews.author: Joe Schonasky

customer_reviews.title: An alternative to my phone
customer_reviews.text: I do like to have a gps to use other than my phone because there are times that I do not want to carry my phone with me. I like that it is a bigger screen. Some of the voice instructions are confusing like "left, then right, then left". Hard to follow what the heck they mean when you are on a straight freeway.
customer_reviews.author: Explorer

customer_reviews.title: Best GPS Ever
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this gps, to replace a 10 year old Garmin. Wow, what a nice upgrade: clear, clean graphics, easy commands, and very user friendly. Additionally, I love the new linking of this unit with Trip Advisor, and real time traffic updates. If you are a frequent traveler, as I am, you will love this unit. This is a fine product.
customer_reviews.author: tech expert

customer_reviews.title: Can't beat the price
customer_reviews.text: This is one million times better than using a smart phone. The only feature that I miss is not having traffic information. Oh well
customer_reviews.author: Dick Sprague

customer_reviews.title: Big screen and easy to pair with the BC40 backup camera.
customer_reviews.text: I had a Pearl backup camera for over 4 years but it's solar powered and started to not hold a charge. I saw the Garmin and its ability to pair with a Garmin backup camera and I knew this would be a good alternative. It works great. I don't have to use my phone now to view the backup camera and it connects every time. I'm happy I got it. Solves a lot of problems. I have a Mini Cooper and its hard to see, especially in parking lots, when backing out of a space.
customer_reviews.author: Dzyngwmn

customer_reviews.title: Best gps on the market
customer_reviews.text: Best GPS I’ve ever owned and I’ve had many before. Voice recognition is kinda a novelty but it works 1 out of 5 times still think it’s a 5 star product
customer_reviews.author: brendon reichard

customer_reviews.title: The great product for the senior
customer_reviews.text: The device graphics are sharp and very clear. Also I as a senior like the larger font size. I bought a Drive Smart 65 with BC 40 camera. It really works well to be used for backup camera. So far I have enjoyed the product without any problem and issue. It satisfies all my needs for navigation.
customer_reviews.author: chong kim

customer_reviews.title: Another quality Garmin product
customer_reviews.text: This unit works grea. It has quite a few new features compared to my old Garmin. I’ve had numerous farming gps units and they’re all fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: mike s

product_meta.title: Garmin DriveSmart 55 & Traffic: GPS navigator with a 5.5” display, hands-free calling, included traffic alerts and information to enrich road trips
product_meta.description: Style:DriveSmart 55 & Traffic| Pattern Name:NavigatorFor drivers who love new adventures while traveling, the Garmin Drive Smart 55 GPS navigator is the ultimate road trip companion. Featuring simple menus and easy-to-read maps, Garmin Drive Smart 55 lets you view turn-by-turn directions at a glance on a bright 5. 5” edge-to-edge touchscreen display. Traffic and map updates are included along with helpful driver alerts to encourage safer driving.
feature_bullets: Simple menus and bright, easy-to-see maps, Display resolution: 1280 x 720 pixels
Voice-activated and ability to pair with a compatible smartphone for hands-free calling
Built-in Wi-Fi connectivity for map and software updates without a computer; BACKUP CAMERA COMPATIBLE: yes (BC 30 or BC 40)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,181 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Included Components: Garmin DriveSmart 55, vehicle suction cup mount, traffic receiver/vehicle power cable, USB cable, quick start manual
